page.title: 02CALKE ABBEY
page.content: This private family house was built in 1703 by Sir John Harpur the 4th Baronet on the site of a 12th century Augustinian priory. The house and its grounds, Calke Abbey, passed to the National Trust in 1984 after the death of Mr Charles Harpur-Crewe. It covers over 1000 square metres in the Baroque style, 3 storeys and about 80 rooms. It is currently being renovated for public opening in 1989. Many of the rooms have been untouched for years & the Drawing Room has its original furnishing and decoration from 1856. There are large collections of some rare butterflies, stuffed birds and animals, legacy of the naturalist Sir Vauncey Harpur- Crewe. There is a stable complex which is being converted into shops & tearooms leaving some for equestrian use.
